description:
Seen in a functional test here:

http://logs.openstack.org/68/454368/1/check/gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial/b715738/console.html#_2017-04-06_22_16_13_208386

2017-04-06 22:16:13.208386 |     b'  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial/nova/utils.py", line 1174, in get_system_metadata_from_image'
2017-04-06 22:16:13.208413 |     b"    value = max(value or 0, flavor['root_gb'])"
2017-04-06 22:16:13.226674 |     b'TypeError: unorderable types: int() > str()'

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22value%20%3D%20max(value%20or%200%2C%20flavor%5B'root_gb'%5D)%5C%22&from=7d
title: TypeError: unorderable types: int() > str() in get_system_metadata_from_image

comments.content:
Seen in a functional test here:

http://logs.openstack.org/68/454368/1/check/gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial/b715738/console.html#_2017-04-06_22_16_13_208386

2017-04-06 22:16:13.208386 |     b'  File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-nova-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial/nova/utils.py", line 1174, in get_system_metadata_from_image'
2017-04-06 22:16:13.208413 |     b"    value = max(value or 0, flavor['root_gb'])"
2017-04-06 22:16:13.226674 |     b'TypeError: unorderable types: int() > str()'

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22value%20%3D%20max(value%20or%200%2C%20flavor%5B'root_gb'%5D)%5C%22&from=7d
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: I'm not really sure how this happens outside of a functional test because in the REST API we get the flavor by id first and then pass that Flavor object to the compute API create() method, so it shouldn't be a dict or have a string root_gb value.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: It looks like these tests are passing in a URL for the flavorRef...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: I guess a URL is supported...weird. So that's probably the string that's getting in there and blowing things up.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: I don't really see how this would work because the server create API looks up the flavor by id, and if given a URL that's not going to work. Unless there is some API extension code that's translating the flavorRef from a URL to an id.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
This should be fine:

user@ubuntu:~/git/project-config$ python3
Python 3.5.2 (default, Nov 17 2016, 17:05:23) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import six.moves.urllib.parse as urlparse
>>> href = 'http://fake.server/1'
>>> urlparse.urlsplit("%s" % href).path.split('/')[-1]
'1'
>>> 

Maybe there is another test running at the same time which stubs out the flavor get by flavorid code to return a dict with string keys.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: The issue might be that we're dealing with an image that has the min_disk property set and it's a string value.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/454442
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/454442
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=6ac1d039da07498afbf01c8ff4a8a96f408db275
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 6ac1d039da07498afbf01c8ff4a8a96f408db275
Author: Matt Riedemann <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Apr 6 23:12:46 2017 -0400

    Image meta min_disk should be int in fake_request_spec
    
    This might be blowing up some concurrently running tests
    by raising a TypeError comparing an int to a str in py35
    jobs. It's hard to reproduce, but we know min_disk should
    be an int so let's just change it.
    
    Change-Id: I153544d2aeefbd2d12543481e3bda75ed0316798
    Closes-Bug: #1680667
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 16.0.0.0b1 development milestone.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
